required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Clinical Evaluation of the Durata or Optisure High Voltage Leads and Ellipse VR ICD Undergoing MRI, an IDE Study
clinical_study.official_title: A Clinical Evaluation of the Durata or Optisure High Voltage Leads and Ellipse VR ICD Undergoing Magnetic Resonance Imaging, an Investigational Device Exemption (IDE) Study

brief_summary.textblock: To demonstrate safety and efficacy of the Durata or Optisure high voltage lead and Ellipse VR ICD in an MRI environment.

detailed_description.textblock: The intent of this IDE study is to evaluate the safety and efficacy of the Durata or Optisure lead and Ellipse VR ICD that have undergone an MRI scan. The patient population under study includes patients indicated for or who have been implanted with a Durata or Optisure lead and an Ellipse VR ICD.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With MRI Scan Related Complications
primary_outcome.time_frame: MRI scan to 1 month post MRI scan
primary_outcome.description: The primary safety endpoint is the number of participants that had an Ellipse ICD and/or a Durata or Optisure lead complication from the day the MRI scan occurred to the 1-month visit. A complication is defined as a serious adverse device effect that requires an invasive intervention or leads to death.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Ventricular Capture Threshold ≤ to 0.5V
primary_outcome.time_frame: pre-MRI scan to 1 month post MRI scan
primary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants of Durata or Optisure (RV) leads implanted with the Ellipse VR ICD with capture threshold increase of ≤ 0.5V at 0.5ms from pre-MRI scan to 1 month post-MRI scan.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Ventricular Sensing Amplitude Decrease of ≤ 50% From Pre-MRI Scan to 1 Month Post MRI Scan
primary_outcome.time_frame: pre-MRI scan to 1 month post MRI scan
primary_outcome.description: Percentage of Participants with Durata or Optisure RV leads implanted with the Ellipse VR ICD with sensing amplitude decrease of ≤ 50% from pre-MRI scan to 1 month post MRI scan.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Ellipse VR ICD and Durata/Optisure lead
arm_group.description: Pts with Ellipse VR ICD and Durata or Optisure RV lead implanted for at least 60 days will receive a non-diagnostic MRI scan of head and chest region

intervention.intervention_name: Ellipse VR ICD and Durata/Optisure lead
intervention.description: Non-diagnostic MRI Scan sequence of head and chest
intervention.arm_group_label: Ellipse VR ICD and Durata/Optisure lead

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Are implanted with the Durata or Optisure lead for at least 60 days (can include patients with Durata or Optisure lead for > 60 days OR patients with a new Ellipse VR ICD and/or Durata/Optisure lead implanted for at least 60 days
- Are implanted with an Ellipse VR ICD pectorally
- Be willing to undergo an elective MRI scan without sedation NOTE: Antianxiety agents (e.g. minor tranquilizers, etc.) may be used as long as the patient can communicate with site personnel during the MRI scan
- Capture threshold is stable < 2.5V @ 0.5ms
- Ventricular sensing is measurable (patient has underlying rhythm > 30bpm) and the sensing amplitude is > 4mV
- Be able to provide informed consent for study participation (legal guardian or legally authorized representative is NOT acceptable)
- Be willing and able to comply with the prescribed follow-up tests and procedures
- Are not contraindicated for an MRI scan (per the MRI Screening Form)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Have a competitor's MRI compatible endocardial lead implanted or capped
- Have another existing active implanted medical device, e.g., neurostimulator, infusion pump, etc., that has MR labeling that will not allow the MRI scans per this protocol to be completed.
- Have a lead revision of the Durata/Optisure lead occur < 60 days of the baseline visit
- Have other non-MRI compatible device or material implanted NOTE: MRI compatible knee replacements, hip replacements, stents, etc. may be included as long as the labeling of these devices allow MRI scans conducted per this protocol NOTE: MRI compatible mechanical, prosthetic, and bioprosthetic heart valves may be included as long as the labeling of these devices allow for MRI scans conducted per this protocol NOTE: Non-removable dental implants may be included
- Have a lead extender, adaptor, or capped/abandoned lead
- Enrolled or intend to participate in a clinical drug and/or device study (investigational device, investigational drug, new indication for a device or drug or additional testing beyond standard of care procedures), which could confound the results of this trial as determined by SJM.
- Pregnant or planning to become pregnant during the duration of the subject's participation in the study
- Have a life expectancy of less than 12 months due to any condition
- Patients with exclusion criteria required by local law (e.g., age)

facility.name: John C. Lincoln North Mountain Hospital
Saint Vincent Consultants in Cardiovascular Diseases
Penn State Milton S. Hershey Medical Center
Donald Guthrie Foundation for Education and Research
Baylor All Saints Medical Center at Fort Worth

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol, Statistical Analysis Plan, and Informed Consent Form

group.title: Ellipse VR ICD and Durata/Optisure Lead
group.description: Pts with Ellipse VR ICD and Durata or Optisure RV lead implanted for at least 60 days will receive a non-diagnostic MRI scan of head and chest region Ellipse VR ICD and Durata/Optisure lead: Non-diagnostic MRI Scan sequence of head and chest

group.title: Ellipse VR ICD and Durata/Optisure Lead
group.description: Pts with Ellipse VR ICD and Durata or Optisure RV lead implanted for at least 60 days will receive a non-diagnostic MRI scan of head and chest region Ellipse VR ICD and Durata/Optisure lead: Non-diagnostic MRI Scan sequence of head and chest

category.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

outcome.title: Number of Participants With MRI Scan Related Complications
outcome.description: The primary safety endpoint is the number of participants that had an Ellipse ICD and/or a Durata or Optisure lead complication from the day the MRI scan occurred to the 1-month visit. A complication is defined as a serious adverse device effect that requires an invasive intervention or leads to death.
outcome.time_frame: MRI scan to 1 month post MRI scan
outcome.population: Of 227 subjects enrolled, 209 subjects completed the pre-MRI scan visit. Of the 209 subjects, 4 subjects did not have eligible study leads, 3 withdrew before 1-month post MRI scan visit and 4 missed 1-month post MRI scan visit. Therefore, 198 subjects who completed 1-month post MRI scan were included in the analysis.

group.title: Ellipse VR ICD and Durata/Optisure Lead

measure.title: Number of Participants With MRI Scan Related Complications
measure.description: The primary safety endpoint is the number of participants that had an Ellipse ICD and/or a Durata or Optisure lead complication from the day the MRI scan occurred to the 1-month visit. A complication is defined as a serious adverse device effect that requires an invasive intervention or leads to death.
measure.population: Of 227 subjects enrolled, 209 subjects completed the pre-MRI scan visit. Of the 209 subjects, 4 subjects did not have eligible study leads, 3 withdrew before 1-month post MRI scan visit and 4 missed 1-month post MRI scan visit. Therefore, 198 subjects who completed 1-month post MRI scan were included in the analysis.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Ventricular Capture Threshold ≤ to 0.5V
outcome.description: Percentage of participants of Durata or Optisure (RV) leads implanted with the Ellipse VR ICD with capture threshold increase of ≤ 0.5V at 0.5ms from pre-MRI scan to 1 month post-MRI scan.
outcome.time_frame: pre-MRI scan to 1 month post MRI scan
outcome.population: Of 227 subjects enrolled, 209 subjects completed the pre-MRI scan visit. Of the 209 subjects, 4 did not have eligible study leads, 13 were missing capture threshold measurements, 3 withdrew before the 1-month post MRI scan visit and 2 missed the 1-month post MRI scan visit. Therefore, 187 subjects were included in the analysis.

reported_events.desc: Protocol defined ADE (Adverse Device Effects), SADEs (Serious Adverse Device Effects), UADE (Unanticipated Adverse Device Effects), and USADEs (Unanticipated Serious Adverse Device Effects) were collected in this trial and were adjudicated by a Clinical Events Committee

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 60 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
